items.content_html: Oh, thank goodness for ‚òïÔ∏è. I‚Äôve got 15 minutes to down another cup before I head over to the office. It is nice to have a later start than usual today.
Baltimore‚Äôs Inner Harbor is nice. I‚Äôm glad I recognize the area in which I‚Äôm staying. My morning destination is a short walk away.

I‚Äôm on my first Amtrak ride in about five years. I forgot how much lateral motion there is as you go. My iPad is bouncing back and forth on the tray table as I watch TV on it. It‚Äôs nice to not be driving, though.
I‚Äôm all packed for my business trip to training in Baltimore. It‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôve had to overnight apart from my family. At least I don‚Äôt have to fly, and can take the train there.
We had a fun weekend, full of seeing actual people, either at our home or theirs. I should remember this kind of thing, as it goes against my general nature, but is good for me and the whole family.
Am I the only one who kept thinking ‚ÄúJake Jortles‚Äù* during the Pats/Jags game tonight? üèà (* Jason Mendoza‚Äôs assumed identity in the latest episode of ‚ÄúThe Good Place‚Äù)
Cleaning the house for a 2-hour play date is very intense and takes about 3 hours!
I drew and colored this under the expert tutelage of my 5-year-old daughter, just before we played together with Wellie-Wishers. üé®
This afternoon‚Äôs docket for my family includes lunch with the in-laws and a rare visit to the brother- and sister-in-laws to see them and their baby boy.

Is it awful that I kind of want a HomePod? When I first watched the product announcement, my impression was ‚Äútoo expensive: hard pass‚Äù but now I kind of want something that sounds really good and just works with my iPhone.
